description: A 12-hectare freshwater lake in the heart of Hanoi, known as the Lake of the Returned Sword. Named after the 15th-century legend of Emperor Le Loi returning a magic sword to the Golden Turtle God after defeating Ming China. The lake serves as Hanoi's spiritual and cultural center, where locals and tourists gather for exercise, relaxation, and cultural activities.
highlights: Ngoc Son Temple on Jade Island - dedicated to 13th-century war hero Tran Hung Dao
The Huc Bridge - beautiful bright red wooden bridge connecting to Ngoc Son Temple
Turtle Tower - 19th-century construction honoring the legendary turtles
Weekend pedestrian paradise (Friday evening to Sunday midnight)
Morning Tai Chi sessions at 6am with locals
Street performances and cultural activities on weekends
Free access and easily walkable perimeter
tips: Visit at 6am to join locals practicing Tai Chi on the shore
Sunset is the best time for photography
On weekends, streets around the lake become pedestrian-only zones
Try local food nearby: Pho, Bun Cha, or Banh Mi sandwiches
The lake area is completely free to access
Walk the perimeter to fully experience the atmosphere
Join a Tai Chi session - beginners are welcome
vibe: Hoan Kiem Lake feels like the gentle heart of Hanoi - a calm meeting place where the city pauses to breathe. Every morning, locals gather at dawn for Tai Chi while mist rises from the water. As the sun sets, the lake transforms into a sublime canvas of colors reflecting ancient pagodas and modern life. It's a place of serenity amid chaos, where legend mingles with daily life and the Golden Turtle God still watches over the city.
